Description: Book of the Dead of Pakharenkhons Pawerem; sheet 6; Hieratic text in red and black ink.
Curator's comments: The papyrus yields 4 compositions in 37 columns. This sheet contains the Great Book of […] Festivals of the Destruction of Enemies, including Chapters B and C of the Book of the Dead spell 175, Sealing of the Mouth of the Enemies (and) Sealing of the Abattoir, and the Spell of the Words of the Butcher. Bibliography: Bommas, ZAS 131 (2004), 95-113. The Beatifications are published in J. Assmann et al. Altaegyptische Totenliturgien III Osirisliturgien in Papyri der Spaetzeit (Heidelberg 2008). See A. Wuethrich in R. Lucarelli et al (ed.), Heraugehen am Tage: Gesammelte Schriften zum altaegyptischen Totenbuch (SAT 17; Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz 2012), p. 153-28. Tarasenko, Mykola. 2016. Studies on the vignettes from chapter 17 of the Book of the Dead. I, The image of mś.w Bdšt in ancient Egyptian mythology (Archaeopress Egyptology 16), Oxford, p. 48. Quack, J.F. 2022. Altägyptische Amulette und ihre Handhabung. Orientalische Religionen in der Antike 31. Tübingen, p. 202.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (189)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57776) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57776)
Gill 2019a / The hieratic ritual books of Pawerem (P. BM EA 10252 and P. BM EA 10081) from the late 4th century BC (including acquisition history on pp. 5-7)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragmentary, fractured, loss Black ink Red ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass (warped) Binding: leather Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
